title: Iran Races to Get Its Oil Out Into the World
content: Iran is rapidly exporting oil, a sign of the unusual logistical steps that Tehran is undertaking as the US mulls joining Israel in bombing the Persian Gulf state. Satellite images of the oil storage sites at Kharg Island show that the reservoirs were only partly full on June 11, but were brimming with crude on June 18. Bloomberg's Alaric Nightingale reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stocks Gain, Oil Eases as Trump Weighs Iran Role: Markets Wrap
content: European equities climbed, the dollar edged lower and oil prices eased after the White House dialed back speculation that the US was on the verge of joining Israel in launching strikes on Iran.

title: Bassiri Tabrizi: Promising To See Diplomacy Back on Table
content: President Trump says he is putting off US action on Iran, for now. The White House says he'll decide within two weeks whether to attack, adding that his goal remains halting uranium enrichment, and he remains open to diplomacy if possible. Gulf leaders are assessing the possibility of the Islamic Republic's clerical regime falling as an impact of the war between Israel and Iran. Aniseh Bassiri Tabrizi, Senior Analyst at Control Risks told Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the next steps ahead. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: This Isn't an Oil Market for Tourists: 3-Minute MLIV
content: Guy Johnson, Kriti Gupta, Lizzy Burden and Mark Cudmore break down today's key themes for analysts and investors on "Bloomberg: The Opening Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kumar: Nuclear Deal Is The Best Case Scenario
content: US President Donald Trump will decide within two weeks whether to strike Iran. The White House says his goal remains halting uranium enrichment, and he remains open to diplomacy if possible. Meanwhile, Israel has continued to strike Iranian nuclear sites, with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warning that their attacks may bring down the leadership in Tehran. Prem Kumar, DGA-Albright Stonebridge Group's Partner & US Former National Security Council Senior MENA Director told Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche about the best case scenario for him. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Drops as Trump Signals Iran Strike Decision Within Two Weeks
content: Oil slumped after President Donald Trump signaled a decision on whether to strike Iran will be made within two weeks, easing fears about an imminent attack from the US.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/20/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Toyota Files $361 Million South Africa Flood Damage Lawsuit: BD
content: Toyota Motors Corp. has brought a lawsuit for 6.5 billion rand ($361 million) in a South African court for 2022 flood damages that shuttered its plant near Durban, Business Day reported.

title: China’s Warning on Blind-Box Toys Sends Pop Mart Shares Sliding
content: Pop Mart International Group Ltd. shares dropped in Hong Kong after a Chinese state media commentary called for stricter regulation of blind-box toys and trading cards, stoking concern over the company’s wildly popular Labubu dolls business.

title: Mideast Financiers Fearful of Possible US Strike On Iran
content: Even against the backdrop of a regional conflict that began in 2023, the Middle East’s main business hubs saw a steady stream of financial workers and firms because the wealthiest Gulf petrostates remained largely insulated.

title: FTSE 100 Live: Pound Pares Gain After May Retail Sales Disappoint
Bloomberg: The China Show 06/20/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: MSCI Signals South Korea Has More Work to Do to Win an Upgrade
content: Global index provider MSCI Inc. signaled that South Korea’s bid to secure an upgrade to developed-market status continues to face several impediments, even as it lauded efforts by the nation’s authorities to improve market access and implement currency reforms.

title: MacCarley: Nobody Is Interested in Going to War
content: US President Donald Trump will decide within two weeks whether to strike Iran. The White House says his goal remains halting uranium enrichment, and he remains open to diplomacy if possible. Mark MacCarley, Retired Major General US Army, spoke to Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the likelihood of the US attacking Iran. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Europe’s Arms Revival Pits Homegrown Wares Against US Stalwarts
content: Europe’s arms manufacturers are duking it out with American rivals to win their slice of the region’s fast-growing military pie, as governments embark on an unprecedented expansion of defense spending.

title: China’s Warning on Blind-Box Toys Sends Pop Mart Shares Sliding
content: Pop Mart International Group Ltd. shares dropped in Hong Kong after a Chinese state media commentary called for stricter regulation of blind-box toys and trading cards. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China’s Rare Earth Magnet Exports Slump in May, Especially to US
content: Chinese exports of rare earth magnets slumped further in May, with shipments to the US showing an especially steep drop due to the trade war with Washington.

title: China’s Record Oil Stockpile Offers Buffer as Iran Crisis Builds
content: Oil refiners in China — the largest takers of Iranian crude — are unfazed for now about the possibility of interruptions to Middle Eastern supplies given the nation has a record stockpile that provides a temporary buffer.

title: NTT Secures Backing for $16.3 Billion Deal to Take Over AI Arm
content: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. said it has secured enough bids to buy NTT Data Group Corp., with the deal worth ¥2.37 trillion ($16.3 billion) expected to boost its AI ambitions and simplify the corporate structure.

title: Trump Sets Two Week Deadline for Iran Strikes | Bloomberg: The Asia Trade, 6/20/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lower Gas Prices to Spur Record July Fourth Road Trips, AAA Says
content: A record number of US drivers are expected to hit the road for the July Fourth holiday period starting next weekend, helped by the cheapest gasoline in four years.

title: Tencent Music Shares Double on Break From China Price Cut Script
content: China tech investors weary of the nation’s relentless price competition can look to one pocket that’s thriving by moving in the opposite direction: online music.

title: Fidelity Fund Bets on Midcaps Saying Tariff Shock Is Over
content: Financial markets have seen the worst of Donald Trump’s tariff threats, helping make midcap stocks an attractive buy as the outlook improves, according to a Fidelity International money manager.

title: Oil Could Spike to $90 If Strait of Hormuz Shut, Citigroup Says
content: Brent crude could jump to around $90 a barrel if the Strait of Hormuz is closed, according to Citigroup Inc., which added that a prolonged halt to shipping through the crucial waterway would be unlikely.

title: Temu US Sales Plunge 25% as Amazon Rival Shifts Focus Elsewhere
content: Temu’s sales decline in the US is deepening as the online marketplace drastically cuts spending on advertising targeting American consumers, signaling a shift in focus after President Donald Trump’s tariff barrage.

title: New World’s Bond Prices Surge as It Nears Refinancing Deal
content: New World Development Co.’s dollar bonds are poised to hit their highest levels this month as the company closes in on a crucial loan refinancing deal.

title: Philippines to Step In Should Peso Weakness Threaten Prices
content: Philippine central bank Governor Eli Remolona said authorities are prepared to intervene more strongly in the foreign-exchange market should the decline in the peso threaten inflation.

title: Morgan Stanley Says Hong Kong’s Housing Sector Is Bottoming Out
content: Hong Kong’s residential property market is poised for a recovery after enduring a seven-year downturn, according to Morgan Stanley.

title: Gold Set for First Weekly Drop in Three as Haven Demand Softens
content: Gold headed for its first weekly drop in three, as a slight easing of geopolitical tensions in the Middle East sapped haven demand and a Federal Reserve inflation warning raised the prospect of fewer rate cuts.

title: It’s Raining Deals, But no Signs of Market Euphoria in India
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Russian Overnight Drone Barrage Hits Ukraine’s Kharkiv and Odesa
content: The cities of Odesa and Kharkiv were hit by massive Russian drone attacks overnight as Moscow continues its daily air attacks against Ukraine.

title: How Thai Political Crisis May Unfold as PM Fights to Keep Job
content: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is fighting to hold on to power less than a year since taking office, after leaked comments critical of the military triggered a political crisis.

title: China Says It Drove Away Philippine Ship From Disputed Shoal
content: China’s coast guard said it drove away a Philippine ship around Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea on Friday.

title: EU to Restrict China’s Access to Medical Device Procurements
content: The European Union will restrict the ability for Chinese medical device manufacturers to access public procurement contracts worth more than €5 million ($5.7 million).

title: Trump Signals He’ll Hold Off Iran Strike to Give Diplomacy Time
content: President Donald Trump will decide within two weeks whether to strike Iran, his spokeswoman said, as Israel hit more Iranian nuclear sites and warned its attacks may bring down the leadership in Tehran.

title: Why Thailand’s Ruling Political Clan Faces a New Threat
content: Thailand’s most prominent political dynasty is on the brink of losing power once again. Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is facing street protests and growing calls to resign amid mounting anger over a leaked phone call with former Cambodian leader Hun Sen, in which she criticized the Thai army for its role in a border dispute with the neighboring country.

title: Trump Allowed to Keep Using National Guard in LA for Now
content: President Donald Trump can continue to use National Guard troops to respond to protests in Los Angeles as a legal challenge over his use of the military proceeds, a federal appeals court ruled.

title: Sanchez Is Putting NATO’s Trump Plan at Risk by Opposing 5% Goal
content: The problems piling up for Primer Minister Pedro Sanchez in Spain are threatening to spill into next week’s NATO summit, with potentially drastic consequences for the rest of the European Union.

title: China Sends Warplanes Near Taiwan After US Lawmakers’ Visit
content: China sent the most warplanes toward Taiwan since October, a move that follows US lawmakers visiting a top military figure and both the UK and Japan sailing warships through the strait separating the island from the Chinese mainland.

title: Fidelity Fund Bets on Midcaps Saying Tariff Shock Is Over
content: Financial markets have seen the worst of Donald Trump’s tariff threats, helping make midcap stocks an attractive buy as the outlook improves, according to a Fidelity International money manager.

title: Political Woes Threaten to Sink Thai Economy Deeper Into Malaise
content: Thailand’s sudden descent into a new political crisis threatens an economy that’s already on the brink of a technical recession and bracing for the impact of the global trade war.

title: Trump Set to Decide Within Two Weeks Whether to Strike Iran
content: President Donald Trump will decide within two weeks whether to strike Iran, his spokeswoman said, as Israel hit more Iranian nuclear sites and warned its attacks may bring down the leadership in Tehran.

title: Malaysia Court Discharges Najib From One of His 1MDB Cases
content: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak succeeded in setting aside another one of his court cases involving troubled state fund 1MDB, in a rare victory for the jailed politician.

title: Social Media Ban Moves Closer in Australia After Tech Trial
content: Australia’s world-first social media ban for under-16s moved closer to implementation after a key trial found that checking a user’s age is technologically possible and can be integrated into existing services.

title: Thai Leader’s Fate Hangs in Balance as Allies Weigh Future
content: The political fate of Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra remains uncertain on Friday as the opposition and nationalist groups continue to pile pressure on her to quit following a leaked phone call in which she criticized her army.

title: Xi Shows No Sign of Rescuing Iran as Trump Ramps Up Pressure
content: China was quick to condemn Israel after its assault against Iran. Yet President Xi Jinping has shown no sign of rushing to provide weapons and other support that would help Tehran face its most critical military test in decades.

title: UK Consumer Confidence Rises, Extending a ‘Fragile’ Rebound
content: The confidence of UK consumers improved for a second straight month, a survey found, extending a rebound that’s at risk of being derailed as war in the Middle East and higher oil prices cloud the economic outlook.

title: Can the UK Afford to Defend Itself Anymore?
content: Caught between a revanchist Russia, US isolationism and a domestic budget dilemma, Britain faces grim choices when it comes to reconstituting its military.

title: EU’s Dombrovskis Says ‘Making Progress’ in Trade Talks With US
content: The European Union is continuing intensive trade talks with the US ahead of a July 9 tariff deadline set by President Donald Trump and is “making progress,” according to EU Economy Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis.

title: Lula Says He’s Up For Reelection If Healthy, Will Beat Far-Right
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insisted that he will run for reelection next year provided he remains healthy, pledging to block the far-right from regaining power in Latin America’s largest nation.

title: Maduro Locks Up Economists Sharing Data on Venezuela’s Decline
content: President Nicolás Maduro has intensified his crackdown on independent economists and consultants, detaining at least eight people in what critics call a bid to control data exposing Venezuela’s decline.

title: Why Everyone in Washington Is Talking About the Congressional Budget Office
content: On today’s Big Take: the Director of the Congressional Budget Office on churning out economic forecasts from inside the center of a political storm.

title: Banks in France Face €5 Billion Dividend Tax Bill, Senator Says
content: Banks in France are facing a combined tax bill of as much as €5 billion ($5.7 billion) over contentious trades that local authorities say were designed to escape levies on dividend payments, according to a lawmaker.

title: Spain Gets New Powers Over Visas, Residence Permits in Gibraltar
content: The European Union and UK agreed to give Spain new powers over the issuance of residency permits, visas and asylum in Gibraltar, as part of an accord to settle the post-Brexit border arrangements for the British overseas territory.

title: Iran Shuts Down Internet in Bid to Tackle Mounting Cyber Attacks
content: Iran imposed a nationwide internet and telephone blackout, telling civilians it’s necessary to prevent Israeli cyber attacks as fears grow the US will join the ongoing conflict.

title: Qatar Weighs $3.5 Billion Tourism Deal on Egypt’s Med Coast
content: Qatar is in advanced talks to invest $3.5 billion in a tourism project on Egypt’s Mediterranean coast, the latest potential Gulf backing for the North African nation’s economy that’s been roiled by regional conflict.

title: Indonesia’s Prabowo Embraces Russia, Skipping G-7 for Putin
content: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto pledged to strengthen relations with Russia at a meeting with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.

title: UN Atomic Body Denies It Gave Israel Cover For Iran Strikes
content: The chief of the United Nations atomic watchdog rejected Iranian allegations that a recent nuclear-inspections report, which determined Tehran is in breach of its legal obligations, “in any way” justified Israel’s attacks on the Islamic Republic.

title: Thiam Party Forms Alliance With Ex-President Before Ivorian Vote
content: Parties led by former Credit Suisse AG Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam and ex-President Laurent Gbagbo agreed to form an alliance after both men were excluded from competing in October elections.

title: Africa Battles to Halt Cholera Cases as Funding Cuts Hurt
content: Health-funding cuts are wreaking havoc on many African countries’ ability to gain control diseases such as cholera, according to the continent’s main health-advisory body.

title: Has Europe Already Lost the AI Arms Race? | Bloomberg Tech: Europe 06/20/2025
content:
Bloomberg Tech: Europe spotlights the biggest names and trends shaping the region's technology ecosystem as the global competition heats up. This monthly, 30-minute 'magazine-style' show features in-depth interviews with top technology leaders, as well as major investors and policymakers - giving you a compelling A to Z of the most consequential innovations, opportunities and challenges.

On today's show, the next industrial revolution is here — powered by AI. The US and China may dominate, but is Europe ready to close the gap? We discuss with Plural CEO, Carina Namih, Giant Ventures, Co-Founder & General Partner, Tommy Stadlen, Balderton Principal, Laura McGinnis and Arm CEO Rene Haas. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Philippine mobile leader Globe Telecom Inc. has mitigated supply chain risks with diversified Chinese and Western vendors, its chief executive officer said, as companies navigate US-China tensions.

content: China tech investors weary of the nation’s relentless price competition can look to one pocket that’s thriving by moving in the opposite direction: online music.

content: Australia’s world-first social media ban for under-16s moved closer to implementation after a key trial found that checking a user’s age is technologically possible and can be integrated into existing services.

title: JD.com Billionaire’s Viral Stunt Reignites China’s Food-Delivery Feud
content: One unusually warm evening in April, Richard Liu revved his scooter through Beijing’s traffic-snarled streets alongside other delivery workers, and then personally handed food orders to surprised customers. Later that night, over spicy hotpot and ice-cold beer, the JD.com Inc. founder welcomed a pair of riders from two rival delivery firms to his company.

title: SpaceX’s Starship Explodes on Test Stand in Yet Another Setback
content: A SpaceX Starship rocket exploded on a test stand in Texas, adding to a series of setbacks to Elon Musk’s space ambitions that include trips to Mars.

title: Eutelsat Raises €1.35 Billion to Build Europe’s Starlink Rival
content: Eutelsat Communications SA is raising €1.35 billion ($1.5 billion) from the French government and other investors in a deal that will help the European company build out its fleet of satellites as an alternative to Elon Musk’s Starlink.

title: Musk’s xAI Sparks New EU Scrutiny Ahead of Potential X Penalty
content: Elon Musk’s $33 billion xAI buyout of social media platform X has sparked new scrutiny from the European Union as regulators size up a penalty under the Digital Services Act.

title: Iran Shuts Down Internet in Bid to Tackle Mounting Cyber Attacks
content: Iran imposed a nationwide internet and telephone blackout, telling civilians it’s necessary to prevent Israeli cyber attacks as fears grow the US will join the ongoing conflict.

title: Saudi’s AI Firm Humain Forms Division Focused On Ads, Gaming
content: Saudi Arabia’s new artificial intelligence company, Humain, has formed a division to work on advertising, video games and film, as the kingdom strives to become a global leader in technology.

title: Eutelsat to Supply French Military With Satellite Coverage
content: Eutelsat SA struck a 10-year deal with the French government to provide connectivity for the country’s military in a win for the satellite operator as it works to make its service sustainable.

title: Skepticism Over Meta’s AI Push Raises the Cost to Recruit Talent
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Riley Griffin reports on Meta Platform Inc.’s costly efforts to recruit talent for its artificial intelligence program.

title: Top Thai Billionaires-Backed Groups Win Digital Bank Permits
content: Three groups led by Charoen Pokphand Group, Gulf Development Pcl and SCB X Pcl have clinched Thailand’s new virtual bank licenses to boost competition in the nation’s banking industry, according to the central bank.

title: Google Suffers Setback in Fight Over EU’s €4.1 Billion Fine
content: Google’s fight against a record €4.1 billion ($4.7 billion) European Union antitrust fine suffered a blow after an adviser to the bloc’s top court said regulators were right to punish the US giant for abusing Android’s market power.

title: Vodafone Appoints Microsoft Executive Pilar López as CFO
content: Vodafone Group Plc has appointed Pilar López as its new chief financial officer following the departure of Luka Mucic, who announced he was leaving last month.

title: Malaysia Files Suit Against Telegram Channels Over Content
content: Malaysia’s communications regulator has filed a civil suit against two Telegram channels over content that it deemed harmful.

title: LG Electronics Is Said to Consider Resuming IPO of Indian Unit
content: LG Electronics Inc. is considering reviving an initial public offering of its Indian unit as soon as September, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Alibaba Cloud to Start Second Data Center in South Korea by June
content: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. will open a second data center in South Korea by the end of June, accelerating its multibillion-dollar bet on artificial intelligence and cloud computing.

title: Alibaba-Backed ‘AI Dragon’ MiniMax Plans Hong Kong IPO
content: MiniMax is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong, people familiar with the situation said, in what would be a landmark industry debut for a Chinese AI startup valued at about $3 billion.

title: Amazon Orders Employees to Relocate to Seattle and Other Hubs
content: Amazon.com Inc. is ordering some corporate employees to move closer to their managers and teams, roiling a workforce already worried about job cuts and warnings from the top that artificial intelligence will shrink their ranks in the coming years.

title: Chipmaker Wolfspeed Nears Bankruptcy Deal With Lenders Including Apollo
content: Struggling chipmaker Wolfspeed Inc. will be taken over by creditors including Apollo Global Management Inc. under a proposal that would put it into bankruptcy just long enough to slash billions of dollars in debt, according to people familiar with the plan.

title: Meta Approaches OpenAI Staff, David Sacks on Genius Act | Bloomberg Tech 6/18/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the impact of the stablecoin legislation that passed the Senate with White House AI and Crypto Czar David Sacks. Plus, Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski talks about the startup's super-app ambitions, Zoox CEO Aicha Evans joins from the company’s new facility to mass-produce robotaxis, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims Meta is offering bonuses as high as $100 million to OpenAI staffers to jump ships. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Blackstone Snaps Up Stakes in Office Buildings Leased by Meta
content: Blackstone Inc.’s real estate business purchased stakes in two office properties in Bellevue, Washington, that are leased by Meta Platforms Inc.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Reprieve
content: President Donald Trump plans to extend for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Trump Is Delaying the US TikTok Ban Again. What’s Next?
content: One of the first actions President Donald Trump took at the outset of his second presidency was granting a stay of execution for TikTok. Two and a half months later, he granted a second, and on June 18, he promised a third.

title: Trump Adviser David Sacks Says China Adept at Evading Chip Curbs
content: White House crypto and artificial intelligence czar David Sacks warned that China has grown adept at evading US export controls and is at most two years behind American semiconductor design capabilities.

title: UK Retail Sales Drop 2.7% in Worrying Sign for Economy
content: UK retail sales suffered the sharpest fall since 2023, in a sharp reversal of consumer spending that suggests the economy could be struggling in the second quarter.

title: UK Budget Deficit Running Below Forecast in Boost for Reeves
content: UK government borrowing came in below forecast in the first two months of the fiscal year, a modest boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves as she faces growing questions over whether she can keep to her budget limits without further tax and spending pain.

title: US Tariff Spike Hits China’s Small Parcels, Squeezing Exporters
content: US tariff hikes on small packages from China triggered a slump in shipments last month, contributing to a huge drop in bilateral trade and roiling exporters like Shein Group Ltd.

title: Fidelity Fund Bets on Midcaps Saying Tariff Shock Is Over
content: Financial markets have seen the worst of Donald Trump’s tariff threats, helping make midcap stocks an attractive buy as the outlook improves, according to a Fidelity International money manager.

content: Japan won’t fixate on the looming date for so-called reciprocal tariffs to go back to higher levels, Tokyo’s top trade negotiator said, signaling that the Asian nation stands ready for the possibility that talks will drag on.

title: Political Woes Threaten to Sink Thai Economy Deeper Into Malaise
content: Thailand’s sudden descent into a new political crisis threatens an economy that’s already on the brink of a technical recession and bracing for the impact of the global trade war.

title: South Korea’s Record Surplus With US Adds Strain to Tariff Talks
content: South Korea’s current account surplus with the US surged to a record high last year, highlighting the challenge President Lee Jae Myung faces as he seeks to secure a trade deal with Donald Trump.

title: Japan to Sound Out Market Players on Tweaks to Bond Issuance
content: Japan’s Finance Ministry will seek feedback from market players later Friday over its planned reductions to super-long bond issuance as it takes steps to quell market turbulence.

title: Japan’s Prices Climb by Most in Two Years Ahead of Election
content: Japan’s key consumer inflation measure accelerated more than expected to a fresh two-year high, as Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba gears up for a summer election and the Bank of Japan mulls the country’s price trajectory.

title: UK Consumer Confidence Rises, Extending a ‘Fragile’ Rebound
content: The confidence of UK consumers improved for a second straight month, a survey found, extending a rebound that’s at risk of being derailed as war in the Middle East and higher oil prices cloud the economic outlook.

title: Xi’s Giant Iron Ore Trader Is Shaking Up a $130 Billion Market
content: Just three years after its founding, a Chinese government-run trader has become the single biggest force in the country’s $130 billion market for iron ore imports.

title: Employees Terrified of ICE Raids Are Failing to Show Up at Work
content: High-profile immigration raids are scaring off workers and leaving employers unsure of how they’ll manage without them.

title: EU’s Dombrovskis Says ‘Making Progress’ in Trade Talks With US
content: The European Union is continuing intensive trade talks with the US ahead of a July 9 tariff deadline set by President Donald Trump and is “making progress,” according to EU Economy Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis.

title: Maduro Locks Up Economists Sharing Data on Venezuela’s Decline
content: President Nicolás Maduro has intensified his crackdown on independent economists and consultants, detaining at least eight people in what critics call a bid to control data exposing Venezuela’s decline.

title: Why Everyone in Washington Is Talking About the Congressional Budget Office
content: On today’s Big Take: the Director of the Congressional Budget Office on churning out economic forecasts from inside the center of a political storm.

title: Doubling Home Construction Will Barely Improve Affordability in Canada: CMHC
content: Doubling the pace of homebuilding in Canada will only bring affordability back to levels seen right before the Covid-19 pandemic, according to a new government report that lowers expectations for the impact of construction on housing costs.

title: Labour Budget Squeezing Middle-Class Workers, BOE Report Finds
content: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ decision to push up taxes for employers and increase the minimum wage is squeezing pay for middle earners, moving work overseas and inflating food prices.

title: IMF Chief Says Now Is Great Time to Boost Global Role of Euro
content: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva sees a chance to strengthen the euro’s wider role.

title: Summers Sees Trump Naming ‘Respected’ Replacement for Powell
content: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said he expects Donald Trump to name a mainstream candidate to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, despite the president’s bashing of the US central bank leader for failing to cut interest rates this year.

title: IMF Sounds Stagnation Alarm on Euro-Zone Economic Growth
content: Europe risks drifting into stagnation without urgent action to tackle slowing growth, weak investment and rising geopolitical threats, the International Monetary Fund warned.

title: BOE Holds Rates and Monitors ‘Deeply Concerning’ Mid-East Events
content: The Bank of England held interest rates at 4.25% in a more divided vote than expected as policymakers weighed up the UK’s softening jobs market and weak growth against a backdrop of mounting geopolitical tensions.

title: SNB Policy Setup Means Big FX Interventions Unlikely, UBS Says
content: Large-scale interventions in the franc by the Swiss National Bank are unlikely even though the currency’s strength pushed interest rates to zero, according to economists at UBS.

title: Russian Minister Warns of Recession as Officials Spar on Economy
content: President Vladimir Putin’s top economic officials openly argued over the state of Russia’s economy during a session at a flagship forum, with one government minister issuing his starkest warning yet that the country may be teetering on the edge of a recession.

title: Eurogroup Chief Search Kicks Off With Donohoe in Prime Position
content: The Eurogroup is about to kick off its search for a new president, with Paschal Donohoe seen on track to win a third term, a feat that would make the Irishman the second-longest-serving chair of the euro zone’s finance-chief meetings.

title: Three Rate Cuts in 24 Hours Show Europe’s Tariff Challenges
content: Three interest-rate cuts in just over 24 hours by central banks in Europe highlighted a shift as monetary officials seek to manage the fallout from Donald Trump’s unpredictable trade policies.

title: India May Cut Oil Product Exports If Strait of Hormuz Is Blocked
content: India is preparing to source crude oil from outside the Persian Gulf and cut its own refined-product exports should the Strait of Hormuz be blocked to ship traffic, Oil Minister Hardeep Puri said Thursday.

title: Turkey Holds Rates, Opens Door to Cuts If Outlook Allows
content: Turkey’s central bank kept its key interest rate unchanged, while signaling that it may cut if the downswing in inflation continues and geopolitical risks ease.

title: SNB Introduces Stealth Negative Rate to Protect Money Market
content: The Swiss National Bank may have cut its interest rate to zero, but the way it penalizes banks’ excess reserve holdings means lenders will face negative rates if they park too much cash at the central bank.

title: UK to Invest £725 Billion in Infrastructure Over Next 10 Years
content: The UK government outlined plans to spend at least £725 billion ($974 billion) on the country’s creaking infrastructure over the next 10 years, as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s push to use investment to lift economic growth and win back support from the electorate.

title: Fed Bides Its Time to Find Out Who Will Pay Tariffs
content: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the Fed’s reluctance to cut rates. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: China’s Warning on Blind-Box Toys Sends Pop Mart Shares Sliding
content: Pop Mart International Group Ltd. shares dropped in Hong Kong after a Chinese state media commentary called for stricter regulation of blind-box toys and trading cards, stoking concern over the company’s wildly popular Labubu dolls business.

title: Luxury Counterfeiters Keep Outsmarting the Makers of $10,000 Handbags
content: Marketplaces are wary of listing counterfeits, but do customers really care?

title: China’s Rare Earth Magnet Exports Slump in May, Especially to US
content: Chinese exports of rare earth magnets slumped further in May, with shipments to the US showing an especially steep drop due to the trade war with Washington.

title: Lower Gas Prices to Spur Record July Fourth Road Trips, AAA Says
content: A record number of US drivers are expected to hit the road for the July Fourth holiday period starting next weekend, helped by the cheapest gasoline in four years.

title: Insider Trading Siblings Used Lockdown to Make £1 Million
content: Before the market opened on Feb. 4, 2020, traders were watching Swiss testing company SGS SA, waiting for its shares to drop.

title: Foreign Automakers’ Share in China Is Only Set to Dwindle
content: The picture for foreign automakers in China doesn’t get any rosier with new research from consultant AlixPartners showing local brands’ dominance will climb to as high as 76% by 2030 as the market share of Japanese, European and US companies dwindles.

title: Temu US Sales Plunge 25% as Amazon Rival Shifts Focus Elsewhere
content: Temu’s sales decline in the US is deepening as the online marketplace drastically cuts spending on advertising targeting American consumers, signaling a shift in focus after President Donald Trump’s tariff barrage.

title: Sondakh’s Rajawali Is Said to Put Sale of Indonesian Gold Miner Archi on Hold
content: PT Rajawali Corp., an Indonesian conglomerate owned by tycoon Peter Sondakh, has halted a potential sale of its controlling interest in gold miner PT Archi Indonesia, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Morgan Stanley Says Hong Kong’s Housing Sector Is Bottoming Out
content: Hong Kong’s residential property market is poised for a recovery after enduring a seven-year downturn, according to Morgan Stanley.

title: China’s Baidu Eyes Robotaxi Expansion to Singapore and Malaysia
content: Baidu Inc. is planning to launch its Apollo Go robotaxi service in Singapore and Malaysia as early as this year, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the company continues to expand its global footprint.

title: Hong Kong Developer Sells $69 Million Luxury House at a Loss
content: Hong Kong developer Chuang’s Consortium International Ltd. is selling a luxury mansion in the upscale Deep Water Bay area at an almost 20% discount, as it seeks cash in a fragile property market.

title: Adnoc’s $19 Billion Santos Bid Exposes Australian Energy Dilemma
content: One of the biggest foreign takeovers in Australian history will force regulators and politicians to weigh who controls critical energy infrastructure against the need to address a looming domestic gas shortfall.

title: Xi’s Giant Iron Ore Trader Is Shaking Up a $130 Billion Market
content: Just three years after its founding, a Chinese government-run trader has become the single biggest force in the country’s $130 billion market for iron ore imports.

title: Ex-Citi Wealth Management Executive to Buy Small Argentine Bank
content: Eduardo Savastano, a former veteran in Citigroup Inc.’s wealth management division, is preparing to acquire almost all of Banco Masventas, a small regional bank in northern Argentina, according to a person with direct knowledge.

title: Stanhope, Cheyne Near Deal to Buy LandSec’s Prime London Project
content: Land Securities Group Plc is in discussions to sell Red Lion Court, a prime London commercial development, as part of its plan to dispose of £2 billion ($2.7 billion) worth of office assets and redeploy those funds into retail and housing instead.

title: Iran Imagery Shows Race to Get Its Oil Out Into the World
content: Iran is racing to get its oil out into the world, a sign of the unusual logistical steps that Tehran is undertaking as the US mulls joining Israel in bombing the Persian Gulf state.

title: Banks in France Face €5 Billion Dividend Tax Bill, Senator Says
content: Banks in France are facing a combined tax bill of as much as €5 billion ($5.7 billion) over contentious trades that local authorities say were designed to escape levies on dividend payments, according to a lawmaker.

title: Germany Holds Early Talks on How to Exit Energy Firm SEFE
content: Germany’s economy ministry is studying options for how to exit nationalized energy company Securing Energy for Europe GmbH, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Societe Generale Asks Staff to Return to Office Four Days a Week
content: Societe Generale SA asked its employees who are on hybrid work schedules to return to the office four days a week, according to an internal memo seen by Bloomberg News.

title: HSBC Said to Create New Team for Tough Infrastructure Deals
content: HSBC Holdings Plc is setting up a dedicated team to finance infrastructure projects that would typically struggle to attract capital from other sources, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Pakistan Draws Several Bidders for Loss-Making National Airline PIA
content: Pakistan’s sale of its national airline has drawn interest from several parties, including domestic carrier Airblue Ltd. and prominent businessmen Muhammad Ali Tabba and Arif Habib.

title: Indian Authorities Push On With Crash Probe, Recorder Analysis
content: India’s Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau is progressing with its probe into the possible cause of the deadly crash last week involving an Air India airliner, which smashed into a densely populated city shortly after takeoff, killing almost everyone on board the Boeing Co. 787.

title: India Seeks Law Banning Non-Conforming Structures Near Airports
content: India plans to clamp down on structures near airports that don’t comply with height regulation, as the governments seeks to tighten aviation safety in the wake of an airliner crash last week that ranks as the country’s worst in several decades.

title: Italy’s Bank Deals Trip Over Pushback From Investors, Rome
content: For almost a year now, Italy has been at the center of a renaissance in European bank takeovers, with at least half a dozen deals proposed. So far, most are stuck in political opposition and competing investor interests.

title: Watchdog Urges Canada to Open Airline Sector to More Foreign Capital
content: Canada should loosen investment rules for airlines to allow full foreign ownership of carriers that fly only within the domestic market, according to the country’s competition watchdog.

title: Billionaire Arnault Grapples With Biggest Slump in LVMH History
content: The luxury goods maker is reeling from a sharp downturn in the €364 billion industry — and questions about succession are growing louder.

title: Barclays Said to Be Among Firms Interested in Buying TSB
content: Banco Sabadell SA’s British unit TSB is attracting initial interest from potential buyers including Barclays Plc and Banco Santander SA, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Erratic Weather Is Hurting Indian Firms in The Biggest Consumer Market
content: Some of India’s largest companies, already hit by a demand slump, are facing a new threat in wooing the country’s 1.4 billion consumers: unpredictable weather.

title: Nippon Steel Says It Could Issue Equity to Fund US Takeover
content: Nippon Steel Corp. will consider a capital increase to fund its long-awaited $14.1 billion purchase of United States Steel Corp. and associated investment promises, the company’s vice chairman said on Thursday.

title: Rio Agrees to Pay $139 Million To Settle Mongolian Mine Dispute
content: Rio Tinto Group has agreed to pay $138.75 million to settle a lawsuit that accused the miner of hiding problems from investors at its giant copper mine in Mongolia.

title: Circle Shares Soar 168% In First Day On NYSE, Potentially Unlocking IPO Market

title: Voyager Technologies Sets Price Range For IPO As Spacetech Funding Takes Off

title: Here Are The Fintech Companies That Could Go Public In 2025
content: After several quiet years, it appears that 2025 may be the year that the U.S. market finally sees a flurry of fintech IPOs. Here are some of the companies we’re keeping our eyes on.

title: Fintech Funding Holds Strong As Airwallex Lands $300M
content: Business payments platform Airwallex has announced that it closed on $300 million at a $6.2 billion valuation. The financing includes $150 million in Series F funding and another $150 million for secondary share purchases.

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: AI Autonomous Agents Are Top 2025 Trend For Seed Investment
content: Earlier this week, we wrote about investment trends popping up at seed stage. However, we left out one area where funding activity was so voluminous it warranted its own dedicated piece. Unsurprisingly, it is about AI.

title: What Seed Trends Say About The Future: Live Long, Recycle And Launch More Satellites
content: After plowing through a huge pile of seed funding rounds, we identified four areas where seed is trending this year: longevity, defense, waste reduction and spacetech. Here's where a lot of that investment is going.

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023
content: Since 2023, 259 new unicorns have joined The Crunchbase Unicorn Board, adding $605 billion in total value and altogether raising $130 billion, Crunchbase data shows. We take a look at who's leading new investments.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
